articles.title: Why Madonna Almost Cried While Recording 'Don't Cry for Me Argentina'
articles.description: Madonna said it was initially difficult for her to sing "Don't Cry for Me Argentina" from Andrew Lloyd Webber's 'Evita.'
articles.content: In “Don’t Cry for Me Argentina,” Eva Perón asks her countrymen not to cry — but this didn’t stop Madonna from nearly crying when she recorded the song. During an interview, Madonna revealed why singing the song was such a daunting task. She also said... [2661 chars]

articles.title: Nathan Doak doesn’t need guided through games… he’s already class, says Ulster Rugby half-back partner Billy Burns
articles.description: For all the focus on the internationals readying themselves to take on Japan, New Zealand and Argentina, there’ll be plenty of eyes too on Billy Burns’ half-back partner Nathan Doak.
articles.content:

articles.title: Argentina's informal peso down 2.05%, country risk widens to all time high
articles.description: Argentina's informal peso rate weakened 2.05% to 195 per dollar on Friday and country risk shot out 19 basis points to an all-time high 1,672 as inflation soars and policy uncertainty mounts ahead of November congressional elections.

articles.title: Dinosaurs May Have Been Socializing Nearly 200 Million Years Ago
articles.description: A trove of fossilized eggs and skeletons in Argentina revealed that some dinosaurs likely traveled in herds and socialized by age.
articles.content:
Paleontologists have found the earliest known evidence that dinosaurs lived in herds — unlike reptiles, and more like penguins and other birds do today — and socialized with each other by age groups.
The scientists, working a rich deposit of fossils ... [800 chars]

articles.title: Rains favor wheat crops in central Argentina - Buenos Aires exchange
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct 20 (Reuters) - Recent showers in central Argentina have helped the development of the country's 2021/22 wheat crops, the Buenos Aires Grains Exchange said on Thursday, although high temperatures expected over the days ahead could pose a risk going forward.The country, a major wheat exporter, especially to neighboring Brazil, is expected to harvest a record

articles.title: IMF sees inflation expectations anchored in Mexico, not in Argentina
articles.description: Inflation expectations remain anchored in Mexico as the central bank has tightened monetary policy while unanchored expectations in Argentina will require action "on a number of fronts" a top official at the International Monetary Fund said on Thursday.
